Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?<RF>turn: or, look?<Rf>
For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.<RF>envy: or, indignation<Rf>
I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.
His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither <FI>is there<Fi> any to deliver <FI>them<Fi>.
Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.<CM>
Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;<RF>affliction: or, iniquity<Rf>
Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.<RF>trouble: or, labour<Rf><RF>sparks…: Heb. the sons of the burning coal lift up to fly<Rf>
I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:
Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:<RF>unsearchable: Heb. there is no search<Rf><RF>without…: Heb. till there be no number<Rf>
Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:<RF>fields: Heb. outplaces<Rf>
To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.
He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform <FI>their<Fi> enterprise.<RF>their enterprise: or, any thing<Rf>
He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.
They meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope in the noonday as in the night.<RF>meet…: or, run into<Rf>
But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.
So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.<CM>
Behold, happy <FI>is<Fi> the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.
He shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
In famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.<RF>power: Heb. hands<Rf>
Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.<RF>from…: or, when the tongue scourgeth<Rf>
At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle <FI>shall be<Fi> in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.<RF>thy tabernacle…: or, peace is thy tabernacle<Rf><RF>sin: or, err<Rf>
Thou shalt know also that thy seed <FI>shall be<Fi> great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.<RF>great: or, much<Rf>
Thou shalt come to <FI>thy<Fi> grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.<RF>cometh in: Heb. ascendeth<Rf>
Lo this, we have searched it, so it <FI>is<Fi>; hear it, and know thou <FI>it<Fi> for thy good.<RF>for…: Heb. for thyself<Rf><CM>
